business.headline: Sensex, Nifty take breather after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 65.92 points at 85,786.30 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 16.65 points to 26,232.20.

Why Zerodha's Nithin Kamath says crypto derivatives need urgent regulationKamath described the current state of crypto derivative exchanges as "a bit like Schrödinger's cat — neither fully regulated nor unregulated."

ITR refund still pending? Here's how to check your status using PANIf your ITR refund for FY24–25 hasn't arrived yet, you're not alone. Many taxpayers are seeing longer delays this year. The good news: you can quickly check your refund status online using just your PAN.

New labour codes: 5 key benefits you must knowWith the new labour codes, gig and platform workers are now officially recognised, giving them entry into an organised safety net that includes insurance, PF benefits and pension provisions.

Markets at record high: Is a bigger bull run coming in 2026?After 14 months of waiting, domestic markets have finally broken past their earlier ceilings. Strong flows, better earnings and a powerful technical breakout now raise a bigger question about whether 2026 becomes the real breakout year.

Sensex, Nifty touch all-time highs before cooling off, investors await GDP dataThe S&P BSE Sensex added 110.87 points to end at 85,720.38, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 10.25 points to close at 26,215.55.
Why more companies are choosing flexible offices over owning spaceCorporations are now intentionally reallocating portions of their real estate portfolios into flexible and fully serviced workspaces.

Why wedding insurance is becoming the next big trend in IndiaIndian weddings are getting grander, costlier and far more unpredictable. As families pour months of planning and significant savings into these celebrations, a single last-minute disruption can derail everything. This rising uncertainty is quietly driving a new trend—wedding insurance.

From crypto to F&O: The hidden tax trap young investors keep missingYoung investors are trading faster than ever, but many overlook how crypto and F&O profits are taxed. Strict rules, tougher scrutiny and poor record-keeping are turning quick gains into unexpected tax headaches.

PSU bank mergers: Do bigger banks mean happier employees?India's tryst with PSB (public sector bank) consolidation dates back more than three decades. The first post-nationalisation merger took place in 1993, when Punjab National Bank (PNB) absorbed the New Bank of India.

RBI plans to update credit scores every 7 days: What is means for borrowersWith credit scores updating every seven days, access to loans, credit cards, and better interest rates may become more immediate and more closely linked to a person's most recent financial behaviour.

ITR refunds 2025: Do salaried individuals receive quicker refunds than business filers?As refund delays continue this year, many taxpayers are wondering whether salaried individuals truly get their money back faster than business filers. With processing moving more slowly for Assessment Year 2025–26, the question has become more relevant than ever.

Whirlpool share price plummets over 10%. Why is it falling today? The slump followed a large 1.5 crore share transaction that took place in early trade as part of a block deal, making it one of the biggest single-day deals for the consumer durables major in recent years.

Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high: Check top stocks you can invest inThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed more than 400 points to move past 86,000, while the Nifty50 touched a record above 26,300. This is the first time in 14 months that both benchmarks have hit new peaks.

When in doubt, choose the customer: IRDAI chief on insurers' grievance handlingIRDAI has stepped in with a strong message to insurers, urging a clear shift toward faster, fairer grievance handling at a time when policyholders are increasingly frustrated with delays and opaque processes.

Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high after 14 months. What next for stock markets? A fresh Sensex and Nifty record has reignited confidence across Dalal Street, lifting traders' moods and shifting market sentiment firmly to the upside. With bulls in control again, is another milestone already on the horizon?
Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high as bull run continues on D-StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex added 224.80 points to 85,836.74, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 60.85 points to 26,266.15 as of 9:25 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will the stock market hit a record high?Sensex, Nifty today: The upbeat mood in global and domestic markets, softer crude oil prices and steady foreign inflows are expected to support the market at the opening bell.

Why relying only on SIPs may hurt your returns in the long runAMFI's October 2025 figures show just how deeply SIPs have entered the Indian investing culture. Monthly SIP contributions touched Rs 29,529.37 crore, the highest ever for the second month in a row and up 16.6% from a year earlier.

Cabinet clears Rs 7,280 crore rare earths scheme amid China's export curbsThe government has cleared a financial outlay of Rs 7,280 crore to set up 6,000 metric tonnes per year of fully integrated REPM manufacturing capacity in India.

entertainment.headline: Actor Kevin Spacey sued again, three new sexual assault cases head to UK court Three men have brought separate civil claims of sexual assault against Kevin Spacey in London, covering incidents alleged to have taken place between 2000 and 2013. The Oscar-winning actor has denied two of the new claims, with a trial date provisionally set for October 2026.

Eternity review: A tender, tidy rom-com with its heart in the right afterlifeRelease Date:Fri Nov 28, 2025 Eternity movie review: Eternity is a rom-com set in a whimsical afterlife where an elderly woman chooses her eternity. The film explores love, memory, and the difficult decisions that shape life without villainising any character, says our review.

Delhi High Court backs Ajay Devgn's personality rights, orders deepfake takedown The Delhi High Court has granted interim relief to actor Ajay Devgn, restraining unauthorised use of his personality traits and ordering removal of obscene content, following allegations of misuse through commercial merchandise and artificial intelligence.

How Mohammed Kutty became Mammootty? Actor introduces friend who named him At a recent event in Kerala, Mammootty publicly introduced his friend Sashidharan as the person who gave him the name that made him a household figure, clarifying longstanding speculation about the origin of his stage name.

Delhi Chief Minister grants tax-free status to Farhan Akhtar's 120 Bahadur Delhi CM Rekha Gupta announced a tax exemption for the film 120 Bahadur, which honours the bravery of Charlie Company during the 1962 Sino-Indian War. She also praised the actors for their portrayal of Major Shaitan Singh Bhati and his regiment's sacrifice.

Rajinikanth arrives in Goa to accept IFFI honour on completing 50 years in cinema Superstar Rajinikanth reached Goa ahead of the 56th International Film Festival of India closing event, where he will be recognised for five decades of contribution to the film industry.

Taylor Swift saw Ryan Reynolds slam Justin Baldoni for fat-shaming Lively: Reports A meeting at Ryan Reynolds and Blake Lively's New York penthouse in April 2023 saw tensions rise between the former and Justin Baldoni over concerns about comments on Lively's weight. Taylor Swift and Hugh Jackman were also present, according to court documents.

The invisible women of Avihitham: How a film on men is all about women's agency Avihitham is a Malayalam film that explores women's agency through a male-centric narrative. It critiques patriarchal voyeurism and highlights the social double standards faced by women in rural communities.

Millie Bobby Brown updates on her bond with Stranger Things co-star David Harbour Millie Bobby Brown has spoken about her relationship with David Harbour after reports of a 'harassment and bullying claim' surfaced. The pair addressed feud rumours, appearing together at the Season 5 premiere.

Regai review: Familiar but engaging Tamil whodunnit that is short and simpleRelease Date:Fri Nov 28, 2025 ZEE5's Regai is a six-episode Tamil murder mystery series inspired by Rajesh Kumar's work. Despite technical flaws and familiar tropes, it remains an engaging and easy watch for crime fans.

Zootopia 2 smashes records, crosses $100M in early box office run Walt Disney Animation's latest release, Zootopia 2, has quickly become a global box office sensation, setting new records in China and achieving strong performance across several countries in its opening days.

Bigg Boss episode 96: Gaurav wins ticket to finale, Ashnoor hits Tanya Gaurav Khanna clinched the first spot in the 'Bigg Boss 19' finale after a tense ticket-to-finale task. Meanwhile, the task left Tanya Mittal emotional following a physical confrontation with Ashnoor Kaur.

Inside Dharmendra's prayer meet: Memories, emotions and a musical tribute A musical tribute was reportedly performed during Dharmendra's prayer meet in Mumbai. The Deol family and numerous film industry figures gathered in Mumbai on Thursday to remember the iconic actor.

I am a soldier's daughter: Celina Jaitly's emotional note after filing for divorce Actor Celina Jaitly has shared an emotional note sharing her feelings after initiating divorce proceedings from her husband, Peter Haag. She expressed that her upbringing as the daughter of a soldier had shaped her approach to adversity.

Ranbir Kapoor, Vicky Kaushal's Air Force look from Love & War sets sparks buzz Some behind-the-scenes images from director Sanjay Leela Bhansali's upcoming film 'Love & War' have surfaced online. The photos offer a glimpse of actors Ranbir Kapoor and Vicky Kaushal in their roles as Air Force officers.

Aamir Khan on introducing son Azad to Dharmendra, missing prayer meet Aamir Khan has shared insights into his close bond with Dharmendra. The superstar opened up about the heartwarming moment when he took his son Azad to meet the late celebrated star. He also explained his absence from the prayer meeting.

Suniel Shetty on South trend he doesn't like when it comes to casting Hindi heroes Suniel Shetty has highlighted a trend of typecasting Hindi heroes in negative roles. The actor reflected on his recent film choices in a recent interview and said he accepted a role in 'Darbar' because he wanted to work with Rajinikanth.

Prime Video, ZEE5, JioHotstar this week: Kantara Hindi, Raktabeej 2, Bel Air and more A mix of period dramas, political thrillers, comedies, and action-packed titles is set to release on OTT between November 24 and November 28. Here is a range of options for your next watch.

Dharmendra prayer meet: Salman, Shabana Azmi arrive; join Bobby Deol, Vidya Balan A prayer meet for late actor Dharmendra was being held in Mumbai following his death on November 24, 2025. Bobby Deol, Salman Khan, Shabana Azmi and other celebrities arrived to pay respects.

general news.headline: Go for Green Card, get handcuffed: US agencies arresting people during interviewsUS federal agencies, including the ICE, are detaining individuals during Green Card interviews at USCIS offices in San Diego. Attorneys said individuals, including spouses of US citizens, with visa overstays but no criminal history, are being taken into custody.

Imran Khan's son alleges death cell isolation, demands proof of lifeImran Khan's son Kasim Khan accuses Pakistan's government of holding the former prime minister in secretive solitary confinement, denying family access and proof of life, and urges global pressure to end what he calls inhumane, politically-driven isolation.

Trump orders review of Green Cards from 19 countries after National Guard shootingTrump ordered a review of Biden-era asylum approvals and Green Cards from 19 high-risk countries. USCIS issued new rules allowing officers to treat origin countries as negative factors in immigration screening.

Kohli, Pant attend MS Dhoni's high-profile get-together in RanchiVirat Kohli, Rishabh Pant and other Indian players visited MS Dhoni's Ranchi home ahead of the ODI series against South Africa as the team regroups after the Test defeat.

Why wasn't Sindh, like Bengal and Punjab, partitioned between India and Pak?Unlike Punjab or Bengal, where the Partition in 1947 gave parts to India and Pakistan, Sindh went completely to the Islamic nation. Its rivers, cities, and centuries of shared culture left behind and uprooted Sindhi Hindus from their homeland. Why isn't any part of Sindh, which finds mention in India's National Anthem, in India?

National Guard member dies day after DC shooting, another critical, says TrumpThe shooting, which unfolded just blocks from the White House, left both soldiers in critical condition before Beckstrom succumbed to her injuries. The suspect, Rahmanullah Lakanwal, an Afghan who spent years in one of the CIA's most secretive combat units, was arrested.

Cyclone Ditwah to bring heavy rain in Tamil Nadu, Andhra today; alerts issuedFishermen have been pulled off large stretches of the Bay, multiple districts of southern states are on red or orange alert as officials said that Cyclone Ditwah's landfall timing will hinge on its shifting track over the next 24 hours.

Rift in Mahayuti as Sena MLA accuses BJP of voter bribery ahead of civic pollsNilesh Rane accused the BJP of attempting to bribe voters ahead of the December 2 civic polls, claiming to have recovered cash from a party worker's home. His brother and BJP MLA Nitesh Rane has refuted the allegations.

MI play it smart, Gujarat Giants struggle: How teams fared in WPL 2026 mega auctionWPL 2026 auction: MI managed to retain the core of their title-winning squad, while Gujarat struggled to make an impact in the auction. DC once again had an excellent auction, maintaining their reputation for smart buys. UP Warriors and RCB also had a decent day.
Amazon's Siddharth Bhagat Breaks Down India's New Beauty Economy—From Global Trends to Tech-Led DiscoveryTracing India's changing beauty codes.

PM Modi to Unveil 77-Foot Lord Ram Statue at Gokarn Jeevottam Mutt in Goa TodayIn this news update, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to unveil a 77-foot tall bronze statue of Lord Ram at the Sri Samasthan Gokaran Jivottam Mutt in South Goa. The event marks the Mutt's 550th-year celebration, with the Prime Minister expected to arrive at the venue at 3:45 PM. India Today's Aishwarya Paliwal reports on the significance of the visit, stating, 'PM Modi has been always focusing on the fact that India needs to be united and unitedly only we will be able to march forward.' The report highlights that the unveiling is a momentous ceremonial occasion, with daily footfall expected to reach up to 10,000 visitors. The programme also follows the recent ceremonial events at the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, reinforcing the cultural significance of the statue's inauguration.

To check crime, UAE stops issuing visas to PakistanisThe UAE has halted most visa issuances for Pakistanis amid concerns over criminal activity. Pakistani officials have warned that restrictions could escalate into a full ban. This dents Pakistan's passport reputation, which is ranked the fourth-last in the world.
Video: Car loses control, plunges into pond; driver saved in dramatic rescueAlert locals rescued a 25-year-old man from a car that sank into a highway-side pond in Pilibhit in Uttar Pradesh.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Nikki Haley's son distances self from Indian roots, tells Republicans to woo Gen ZNalin Haley, son of Indian-American Republican leader Nikki Haley, has distanced himself from his Indian roots, saying he holds loyalty only to the United States. He also criticised Republicans for failing to listen to Gen Z voices. The 24-year-old also attributed Democrat Zohran Mamdani's victory in the New York City's mayoral race to Gen Z voters.

'Word power' remark was for Constitution Day: Shivakumar amid Karnataka drama Live UpdatesKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar said his "word power is world power" remark was made in the context of Constitution Day and not aimed at the Congress leadership, amid renewed speculation over a power-sharing pact with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah.

Gautam Gambhir's press conference of contradictionsIndia lost their second Test match against South Africa by a record margin of 408 runs. Just when everyone thought that this was as bad as it gets, head coach Gautam Gambhir attended the press conference and said some bizarre things in the aftermath of the series.

Delhi air on brink of severe, AQI breaches 400 at multiple stationsOut of 39 monitoring stations across the city, 19 recorded pollution in severe range. Noida's air quality was recorded in the severe category, while Greater Noida (380), Ghaziabad (351) and Gurugram (318) remain in the very poor range.

Andhra King Taluka review: Ram Pothineni delivers his strongest performance yetRelease Date:Thu Nov 27, 2025Andhra King Taluka movie review: Andhra King Taluka captures the purity of fan devotion with heart and sincerity, even as predictable writing and commercial choices hold it back from becoming the truly great film it could have been.

Can your food habits impact your partner's gut health?What you eat and how you eat doesn't just affect your body; it can also influence your partner's gut health. In that way, your daily food choices become a shared responsibility to keep both of you healthy.

sports.headline: Once a Kolpak outcast, Simon Harmer rediscovers himself as SA's hero in India Tests Once discarded after a bruising India tour in 2015, Simon Harmer rebuilt himself through Kolpak exile, county grit and quiet reinvention. In India, he returned transformed, taking 17 wickets and pulling the strings like a master puppeteer.

Ashes 2025: Cummins to miss Brisbane Test as Australia name unchanged squad Pat Cummins continues to remain on the sidelines as Australia named an unchanged squad for the second Ashes 2025-26 Test in Brisbane. Cummins will travel with the squad to step up his recovery process.

Why Alyssa Healy went unsold in WPL 2026 auction? Team coaches explain call WPL team coaches explained the reason why Australia captain Alyssa Healy went unsold during the 2026 auction on Thursday, November 27. Despite having a base price of Rs. 50 Lakh, none of the teams bid for Healy.

Against all odds: Ashok Parmar dreams of glory for India on international stage Despite being affected by polio at a young age, para-athlete Ashok Parmar continues to defy all odds and excel in the field of weightlifting and marathon running. Ahead of the Adani Ahmedabad Marathon, Ashok talks about getting into sports and the dream of representing India on the international stage.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma lead India's practice in Ranchi ahead of 1st ODIVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma had their first net session in Ranchi ahead of India's first ODI against South Africa. The star duo return for their first international game since playing the 3-match ODI series in Australia.

Stop saying India would've beaten South Africa with Kohli, Rohit: Sunil GavaskarIND vs SA: Would India have avoided the Test series disaster against South Africa if Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli were still around? Legendary Sunil Gavaskar makes strong remarks on the burning question that has been floating on social media since the defeat.

PM Modi meets Indian blind women's cricket team after historic T20 World Cup triumphPM Narendra Modi met the Indian women's blind cricket team after their unbeaten run to the inaugural Blind Women's T20 World Cup title, celebrating their historic win.

Jr. Men's Hockey World Cup: PR Sreejesh's young India chase third titleThe Indian team will be aiming to win their third title as they step on to the field for the Jr.men's Hockey World Cup in Chennai and Madurai, starting from November 28. With PR Sreejesh at the helm and filled with HIL stars, India will look to end a nine-year wait for the crown.

Old is gold: Ageless Shikha Pandey bags Rs 2.4 crore move to UP WarriorzShikha Pandey has been keeping herself active by taking part in leagues across the globe. This experience has certainly upped her stocks, which resulted in a Rs 2.4 crore deal with the UP Warriorz at the WPL 2026 mega auction.

16-year-old Tanvi shocks ex-world champ, Prannoy beaten by teen compatriotTanvi Sharma upset former world champion Nozomi Okuhara to reach Syed Modi International quarterfinals in Lucknow on Thursday. Meanwhile, 19-year-old Manraj Singh defeated HS Prannoy in men's singles second round.

Bangladesh vs Ireland, 1st T20I: Highlights from ChattogramBAN vs IRE, 1st T20I Highlights: Litton Das' Bangladesh have won the toss and opted to field. The Tigers recently won the Test series and will look to carry the momentum into the shorter format.

Manoj Tiwary hammers Gautam Gambhir, says India's Test team needs a new head coachFormer India cricketer, Manoj Tiwary believes that the Indian Test team needs a new coach and Gautam Gambhir was never the man for the job.

Pakistan vs Sri Lanka, T20I tri-series, Match 6: Highlights from RawalpindiPAK vs SL, T20I tri-series, Match 4 Highlights: Pakistan have won the toss and opted to bowl first in Rawalpindi. The game will decide between Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe, who will join Pakistan in the final.

WPL Auction: Deepti, Kerr bag big money, Healy unsold in marquee listWPL Auction: World Cup hero Deepti Sharma fetched the biggest price in the marquee list in the Women's Premier League mega-auction on Thursday, November 27. Australia captain Alyssa Healy was the only player to remain unsold from the list.

BCCI announces WPL schedule: 4th edition from Jan 9 to Feb 5 in two citiesThe Women's Premier League 2026 will be played across two venues — Navi Mumbai and Vadodara. WPL chairman Jayesh George confirmed that the season will begin on 9 January in Navi Mumbai and conclude on 5 February in Vadodara.

Rishabh Pant says sorry to fans in long post after India's 0-2 loss to SAIndia vice-captain Rishabh Pant has apologised to the fans after the team's embarrassing 0-2 series loss against South Africa. The Indian team were outclassed by the Proteas, who defeated the hosts by 408 runs in Guwahati Test.

Ahead of WPL 2026 auction, Sophie Devine sets the stage on fire in WBBLSophie Devine's all-round performance guided Perth Scorchers to a four-wicket win over Melbourne Renegades, overcoming a late collapse to secure the points at Junction Oval. Alice Capsey's four wickets threatened to turn the contest, but the visitors held their nerve in a tense finish.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
